actor_awards.notes: Won two Academy Awards (Best Picture and Best Director) for 'Gandhi' (1982). As an actor, he won three Golden Globes and four BAFTA Awards. He was made a CBE in 1967 and knighted in 1976.

filmography.title: Jurassic Park
filmography.role_description: The eccentric billionaire and creator of a theme park populated by cloned dinosaurs.
filmography.plot: A pragmatic paleontologist touring an almost complete theme park on an island in Central America is tasked with protecting a couple of kids after a power failure causes the park's cloned dinosaurs to run loose.
filmography.awards: Saturn Award: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: The Great Escape
filmography.role_description: The mastermind behind the massive escape plan, known as 'Big X'.
filmography.plot: Allied prisoners of war plan for several hundred of their number to escape from a German camp during World War II.

filmography.title: Brighton Rock
filmography.role_description: A teenage gangster in Brighton who commits murder and marries a witness to silence her.
filmography.plot: A small-time gang leader commits a murder and then desperately tries to cover his tracks.

filmography.title: 10 Rillington Place
filmography.role_description: A chilling portrayal of the real-life serial killer who frames his neighbor for his crimes.
filmography.plot: The true story of British serial killer John Christie, who murdered several women in the 1940s and 1950s.
filmography.awards: Berlin International Film Festival: Nomination – Golden Bear

filmography.title: Miracle on 34th Street
filmography.role_description: A kind old man who claims to be Santa Claus and is put on trial to prove his identity.
filmography.plot: A lawyer and a little girl must prove that a man claiming to be Santa Claus is the real thing.
filmography.awards: Saturn Award: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: The Sand Pebbles
filmography.role_description: A seasoned sailor who befriends the protagonist and falls in love with a Chinese woman.
filmography.plot: In 1926 China, an engineer on a U.S. Navy gunboat tries to avoid political intrigue but eventually gets caught in the middle of a revolution.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: Seance on a Wet Afternoon
filmography.role_description: The submissive husband of a medium who is coerced into kidnapping a child to help his wife's career.
filmography.plot: A medium convinces her husband to kidnap a child so she can help the police solve the crime and gain fame.

filmography.title: Guns at Batasi
filmography.role_description: A strict Regimental Sergeant Major who tries to maintain order during a coup in an African nation.
filmography.plot: British soldiers in an African country find themselves under siege during a military coup.

filmography.title: Doctor Dolittle
filmography.role_description: A flamboyant circus owner who exhibits the two-headed Pushmi-Pullyu.
filmography.plot: A doctor who can talk to animals embarks on an adventure to find the legendary Great Pink Sea Snail.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: The Flight of the Phoenix
filmography.role_description: The navigator of a crashed plane, an alcoholic who serves as a mediator between the survivors.
filmography.plot: After a plane crash in the Sahara, one of the survivors announces that he's an airplane designer and they can make a flyable plane from the wreckage.

filmography.title: The Angry Silence
filmography.role_description: A factory worker who is ostracized by his coworkers for refusing to participate in a wildcat strike.
filmography.plot: A factory worker refuses to join an unofficial strike and is 'sent to Coventry' by his colleagues.

filmography.title: The League of Gentlemen
filmography.role_description: A black-market dealer and expert in electronics who joins a group of former army officers to rob a bank.
filmography.plot: A disgruntled veteran recruits a group of former army officers to pull off a daring bank robbery.

filmography.title: I'm All Right Jack
filmography.role_description: A corrupt businessman involved in a scheme to profit from a missile contract.
filmography.plot: A naive upper-class man takes a job in a missile factory and unwittingly causes a major labor dispute.

filmography.title: Dunkirk
filmography.role_description: A civilian who owns a garage and reluctantly takes his boat to help in the evacuation.
filmography.plot: Two stories in one: a squad of soldiers fighting their way to the beach and a journalist trying to wake up the British public to the war's reality.

filmography.title: In Which We Serve
filmography.role_description: Attenborough's first screen role, playing a cowardly stoker on a British destroyer.
filmography.plot: The story of a British naval ship and its crew during the Battle of Crete.

filmography.title: The Guinea Pig
filmography.role_description: A working-class boy who is sent to an exclusive public school as part of an experiment.
filmography.plot: A young boy from a lower-class background wins a scholarship to a prestigious public school and faces class prejudice.

filmography.title: Morning Departure
filmography.role_description: A nervous crew member aboard a submarine that hits a mine and sinks.
filmography.plot: The crew of a British submarine is trapped on the sea floor after striking a rogue mine.

filmography.title: Elizabeth
filmography.role_description: The loyal chief advisor to Queen Elizabeth I during her early years as monarch.
filmography.plot: The early years of the reign of Elizabeth I of England and her difficult task of learning what is necessary to be a monarch.

filmography.title: Hamlet
filmography.role_description: A cameo appearance in Kenneth Branagh's full-text adaptation of Shakespeare's play.
filmography.plot: Hamlet, Prince of Denmark, returns home to find his father murdered and his mother remarried to the murderer, his uncle.

filmography.title: And Then There Were None
filmography.role_description: A judge who is one of ten people invited to a remote hotel where they are killed off one by one.
filmography.plot: Ten strangers are summoned to a remote hotel in the Iranian desert by a mysterious host, only to find that they are being killed off one by one.

filmography.title: Brannigan
filmography.role_description: A British police commander who clashes with John Wayne's American cop character in London.
filmography.plot: A Chicago police lieutenant is sent to London to escort a criminal back to the US, but the criminal is kidnapped.

filmography.title: The Human Factor
filmography.role_description: A British security officer tasked with finding a double agent in the Foreign Office.
filmography.plot: When a leak of information is discovered in a division of British Intelligence, the security section is called in to locate the source.

filmography.title: The Lost World: Jurassic Park
filmography.role_description: Hammond returns, now an environmentalist trying to protect the dinosaurs on a second island.
filmography.plot: A research team is sent to the Jurassic Park Site B island to study the dinosaurs there, while an InGen team approaches with another agenda.

filmography.title: Rosebud
filmography.role_description: The leader of a terrorist group that kidnaps five wealthy girls.
filmography.plot: A CIA agent tries to rescue five girls kidnapped by the Palestinian Liberation Army from a yacht.

filmography.title: Conduct Unbecoming
filmography.role_description: An officer involved in a secret trial of a lieutenant accused of assaulting a widow.
filmography.plot: A British regiment in India holds a secret trial for a lieutenant accused of attacking the widow of a hero.

filmography.title: The Man Upstairs
filmography.role_description: A scientist who has a mental breakdown and causes a standoff in his boarding house.
filmography.plot: A scientist suffering from a breakdown locks himself in his room, leading to a tense situation with the other residents and the police.

filmography.title: Private's Progress
filmography.role_description: A soldier involved in a scheme to steal art during WWII.
filmography.plot: An undergraduate is called up to the army and gets involved in a scheme to steal art treasures from the Germans.

filmography.title: Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat
filmography.role_description: The father of Joseph and his eleven brothers in this musical adaptation.
filmography.plot: A musical adaptation of the biblical story of Joseph and his coat of many colors.
